subject: College Athletics
Bowl Games
lead_paragraph: U.C.L.A. Coach Karl Dorrell was fired yesterday, a day after the Bruins accepted a bowl bid and two days after a loss to their crosstown rival, Southern California. Dorrell, 43, was let go despite leading the Bruins to a postseason game in each of his five seasons at U.C.L.A., which had an outside chance to reach the Rose Bowl before its loss to U.S.C. The firing of Dorrell, who is black, leaves five black head coaches at 119 major college programs.Dorrell had a 35-27 record. U.C.L.A. (6-6) will play Brigham Young (10-2) in the Las Vegas Bowl on Dec. 22. The defensive coordinator DeWayne Walker will be the interim coach.
